hypothesis_content.title: Term Structure Flattening Momentum Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's volatility term structure flattens significantly (30-day IV minus 7-day IV < 2 volatility points) during NEUTRAL/BULL regimes, and the flattening coincides with increasing spot volume (>1.2x 20-day average), the subsequent 7-day price movement will exhibit positive momentum with realized volatility expanding to match the front-end of the term structure.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Flattening term structure during increasing volume suggests options markets are repricing near-term volatility expectations upward. This often precedes directional moves as dealers hedge gamma exposure. The regime filter avoids bear markets where flattening may indicate capitulation.
entry_conditions: BTC spot volume > 1.2x 20-day average for 2 consecutive days
Term structure flattening occurs from backwardation moving toward contango
Price above 200-day moving average (for BULL filter) OR between 100-200 DMA (for NEUTRAL)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7-day realized volatility reaches 90% of 7-day IV at entry OR price reaches 1.5x average true range (14-day) target
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Term structure re-steepens to >5 volatility points difference

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of signals fail to realize volatility expansion (7-day RV remains below 70% of entry 7-day IV) OR price shows negative momentum despite volume increase.
